body:
$!You must tell DVLA if you have Asperger syndrome and it affects your driving.$!

%You can be fined up to £1,000 if you don’t tell DVLA about a medical condition that affects your driving. If you’re involved in an accident, you may be prosecuted.%

##Car or motorcycle licence

Check with your doctor if you're unsure whether your Asperger syndrome affects your driving.

If it does, you must tell DVLA. Fill in form M1 and send it to DVLA. The address is on the form.

$D[Download 'M1 - Confidential medical information' (PDF, 252KB)](http://www.direct.gov.uk/prod_consum_dg/groups/dg_digitalassets/@dg/@en/@motor/documents/digitalasset/dg_065614.pdf "Download medical questionnaire"){:rel="external"}$D

##Bus, coach or lorry licence

Check with your doctor if you're unsure whether your Asperger syndrome affects your driving.

If it does, you must tell DVLA. Fill in form M1V and send it to DVLA. The address is on the form.

$D[Download 'M1V - Confidential medical information' (PDF, 243KB)](http://www.direct.gov.uk/prod_consum_dg/groups/dg_digitalassets/@dg/@en/@motor/documents/digitalasset/dg_065273.pdf "Download medical questionnaire"){:rel="external"}$D

*[DVLA]: Driver & Vehicle Licensing Agency
overview: You must tell DVLA if you have Asperger syndrome and it affects your driving - download the correct form to let them know
title: Asperger syndrome and driving
